page.title: 06CHURWELL TODAY.
page.content: Churwell grew up along a Roman road, now Old Road.The oldest building in the area is Manor House Farm,dated 1605 where Oliver Cromwell possibly stayed. Elland Road was built parallel to the Roman road and the main shops and public houses built along side it.It was a toll road.The number of shops declined after the opening of a super- market in Morley.Today there are 3 public houses,4 small food shops and 4 other shops.A barber's,butcher's,elec- trician's,2 fish and chip shops and 2 Co-op's have all disappeared. An annual event is the Pram Race in June,run fromthe Working Men's Club to Morley.People dress up in costumes and push prams with people in them,some dressed as babies.the contestants have to stop at each public house on route to take a drink.
